abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the GEF-Western Indian
            Ocean Marine Highway Development and Coastal and Marine
            Contamination Prevention Project for Africa is to increase
            the safety and efficiency of navigation. The proposed
            reallocation from the unallocated category to category 2(b)
            finances additional goods included in the Project
            Description which include oil spill combating equipment kits
            by Indian Ocean Commission (IOC). The reallocation does not
            result in a change to the project activities nor require a
            modification to the project description in the grant
            agreement and as such is considered to be minor in nature.
            The project also implemented a US$100,000 grant from the
            European space agency to carry out earth observation to
            detect oil spills in real time and monitor the health of
            selected coral reefs along the surveyed corridor and the
            marine route. The project closing date was extended to
            December 31, 2012 after the mid-term review (November 2010).
